document_title: Gestational diabetes: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: dai-thao-duong-thai-ky.json_2_Methods of diagnosing diabetes in pregnancy
subsection_content:
To diagnose, the doctor will conduct a test for gestational diabetes by checking the pregnant woman's blood sugar level. Normally, pregnant women will be routinely screened with a glucose tolerance test between weeks 24-28 of gestation.
Glucose tolerance test: You are asked to fast (not eat for 8 hours) before the test. Next, your doctor draws your blood before and after you drink a liquid containing 75 grams of sugar. The test results will show whether you have gestational diabetes or not.
